articles.title: CDC Warns Doctors to Look Out for Mystery Liver Illness in Children - Gizmodo
articles.description: At least nine children in the U.S. and over 100 in Europe have contracted the severe and unexplained hepatitis, with many needing a liver transplant.
articles.content: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is warning doctors to keep an eye out for mysterious cases of hepatitis that are affecting young kids in the U.S. and elsewhere. Two children in the U.S… [+3139 chars]

articles.title: Explainer-Scientists investigate hepatitis outbreak in children in Europe, US - FX Empire
articles.description: By Jennifer Rigby and Natalie Grover LONDON (Reuters) -   Health authorities around the world are investigating a mysterious increase in severe cases of hepatitis - inflammation of the liver – in young children.
articles.content:
Below is a summary of what is known about the outbreak. 
WHATS HAPPENED?
More than 130 cases have been identified, with the majority in Britain, which has reported 108 cases since January.

articles.author: Alex Reis
articles.title: Less use of mobile phones for better health - The European Scientist
articles.description: We may all use our mobile phones too much, but the good news is that we don't have to give them up altogether to be healthier, according to a study published in the Journal of Experimental Psychology.

articles.author: James Vincent
articles.title: Google gives Europe a 'reject all' button for tracking cookies after fines from watchdogs - The Verge
articles.description: Google is updating its cookie banners in Europe, giving users the option to reject all tracking cookies with a single click. Google was previously fined by French watchdog CNIL for steering users away from rejecting cookies.
articles.content:
Well-balanced menus make rejection as easy as acceptance
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
